text: Ardently do today what must be done. Who knows? Tomorrow, death comes.
author: The Buddha

text: Always seek out the seed of triumph in every adversity.
author: Og Mandino

text: He who knows, does not speak. He who speaks, does not know.
author: Laozi

text: Avoid having your ego so close to your position that when your position falls, your ego goes with it.
author: Colin Powell

text: They must often change, who would be constant in happiness or wisdom.
author: Confucius

text: It is impossible to love and to be wise.
author: Francis Bacon

text: No party has a monopoly on wisdom. No democracy works without compromise.
author: Barack Obama

text: To study and not think is a waste. To think and not study is dangerous.
author: Confucius

text: These days people seek knowledge, not wisdom. Knowledge is of the past; wisdom is of the future.
author: Vernon Cooper

text: And I love that even in the toughest moments, when we're all sweating it - when we're worried that the bill won't pass, and it seems like all is lost - Barack never lets himself get distracted by the chatter and the noise. Just like his grandmother, he just keeps getting up and moving forward... with patience and wisdom, and courage and grace.
author: Michelle Obama

text: Thought is the blossom; language the bud; action the fruit behind it.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Knowledge is of no value unless you put it into practice.
author: Anton Chekhov

text: The most certain sign of wisdom is cheerfulness.
author: Michel de Montaigne

text: If you only have a hammer, you tend to see every problem as a nail.
author: Abraham Maslow

text: Study the past, if you would divine the future.
author: Confucius

text: We don't receive wisdom; we must discover it for ourselves after a journey that no one can take for us or spare us.
author: Marcel Proust

text: Grief can be the garden of compassion. If you keep your heart open through everything, your pain can become your greatest ally in your life's search for love and wisdom.
author: Rumi

text: The young man knows the rules, but the old man knows the exceptions.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr.

text: Start with what is right rather than what is acceptable.
author: Franz Kafka

text: Where there is charity and wisdom, there is neither fear nor ignorance.
author: Francis of Assisi

text: Everyone in the world ought to do the things for which he is specially adapted. It is the part of wisdom to recognize what each one of us is best fitted for, and it is the part of education to perfect and utilize such predispositions. Because education can direct and aid nature but can never transform her.
author: Maria Montessori

text: Make it your habit not to be critical about small things.
author: Edward Everett Hale

text: To keep your secret is wisdom; but to expect others to keep it is folly.
author: Samuel Johnson

text: Appreciation can make a day, even change a life. Your willingness to put it into words is all that is necessary.
author: Margaret Cousins

text: As an elephant in the battlefield withstands arrows shot from bows all around, even so shall I endure abuse.
author: The Buddha

text: Silence at the proper season is wisdom, and better than any speech.
author: Plutarch

text: Respect should be earned by actions, and not acquired by years.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

text: I will not be concerned at other men's not knowing me; I will be concerned at my own want of ability.
author: Confucius

text: The superior man is satisfied and composed; the mean man is always full of distress.
author: Confucius

text: The sum of wisdom is that time is never lost that is devoted to work.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Do not scorn what you have received, nor envy the gains of others. He who envies others does not obtain peace of mind.
author: The Buddha

text: He is no fool who gives what he cannot keep to gain what he cannot lose.
author: Jim Elliot

text: Adopt the pace of nature: her secret is patience.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Nature and books belong to the eyes that see them.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Begin, be bold, and venture to be wise.
author: Horace

text: To have much learning and skill, to be well-trained in discipline, and good in speech — this is the highest blessing.
author: The Buddha

text: Meditation brings wisdom, lack of meditation leaves ignorance. Know well what leads you forward and what holds you back and choose the path that leads to wisdom.
author: The Buddha

text: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
author: Isocrates

text: The greatest obstacle to discovery is not ignorance - it is the illusion of knowledge.
author: Daniel J. Boorstin

text: Our greatness lies not so much in being able to remake the world as being able to remake ourselves.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Great indeed is the sublimity of the Creative, to which all beings owe their beginning, and which permeates all heaven.
author: Laozi

text: Ignorant men raise questions that wise men answered a thousand years ago.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: Change will not come if we wait for some other person or some other time. We are the ones we've been waiting for. We are the change that we seek.
author: Barack Obama

text: Applause is a receipt, not a bill.
author: Dale Carnegie

text: Never accept ultimatums, conventional wisdom, or absolutes.
author: Christopher Reeve

text: There is a wisdom of the head, and a wisdom of the heart.
author: Charles Dickens

text: Without courage, wisdom bears no fruit.
author: Baltasar Gracián

text: Sincerity is the way of Heaven. The attainment of sincerity is the way of men.
author: Confucius

text: An ant on the move does more than a dozing ox
author: Laozi

text: Commitment is an act, not a word.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

text: Wisdom has its root in goodness, not goodness its root in wisdom.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Wisdom begins in wonder.
author: Socrates

text: Cleverness is not wisdom.
author: Euripides

text: It requires wisdom to understand wisdom: the music is nothing if the audience is deaf.
author: Walter Lippmann

text: With age comes wisdom and a high sex drive. And the wisdom to enjoy it.
author: Amber Valletta

text: Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens.
author: Jimi Hendrix

text: Wisdom comes alone through suffering.
author: Aeschylus

text: Wisdom begins at the end.
author: Daniel Webster

text: Kindness is more important than wisdom, and the recognition of this is the beginning of wisdom.
author: Theodore Isaac Rubin

text: Pure, holy simplicity confounds all the wisdom of this world and the wisdom of the flesh.
author: Francis of Assisi

text: Patience is the companion of wisdom.
author: Augustine of Hippo

text: Wisdom is found only in truth.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: Not engaging in ignorance is wisdom.
author: Bodhidharma

text: Wisdom is the supreme part of happiness.
author: Sophocles

text: Wisdom consists of the anticipation of consequences.
author: Norman Cousins

text: Much wisdom often goes with fewer words.
author: Sophocles

text: Wisdom is always an overmatch for strength.
author: Phil Jackson

text: The doors of wisdom are never shut.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Memory is the mother of all wisdom.
author: Samuel Johnson

text: A short saying often contains much wisdom.
author: Sophocles

text: All wisdom does not reside in Delhi.
author: P. Chidambaram

text: Much wisdom often goes with fewest words.
author: Sophocles

text: The truest wisdom is a resolute determination.
author: Napoleon

text: Silence is the sleep that nourishes wisdom.
author: Francis Bacon

text: Good people are good because they've come to wisdom through failure. We get very little wisdom from success, you know.
author: William Saroyan

text: Along with success comes a reputation for wisdom.
author: Euripides

text: Wisdom alone is the science of other sciences.
author: Plato

text: Cunning... is but the low mimic of wisdom.
author: Plato

text: Science is organized knowledge. Wisdom is organized life.
author: Immanuel Kant

text: A prudent question is one half of wisdom.
author: Francis Bacon

text: To conquer fear is the beginning of wisdom.
author: Bertrand Russell

text: Knowing others is wisdom, knowing yourself is Enlightenment.
author: Laozi

text: Nine-tenths of wisdom is being wise in time.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: The pine stays green in winter... wisdom in hardship.
author: Norman Douglas

text: Wisdom has never made a bigot, but learning has.
author: Josh Billings

text: Logic is the beginning of wisdom, not the end.
author: Leonard Nimoy

text: Mistakes are the usual bridge between inexperience and wisdom.
author: Phyllis Grissim-Theroux

text: A poem begins in delight and ends in wisdom.
author: Robert Frost

text: Many sophisticated, intelligent people lack wisdom and common sense.
author: Joyce Meyer

text: Wisdom ceases to be wisdom when it becomes too proud to weep, too grave to laugh, and too selfish to seek other than itself.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: Vanity can easily overtake wisdom. It usually overtakes common sense.
author: Julian Casablancas

text: What wisdom can you find that is greater than kindness?
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

text: Wisdom often times consists of knowing what to do next.
author: Herbert Hoover

text: It is good even for old men to learn wisdom.
author: Aeschylus

text: The three great essentials to achieve anything worthwhile are: Hard work, Stick-to-itiveness, and Common sense.
author: Thomas Edison

text: Imagination is more important than knowledge. For while knowledge defines all we currently know and understand, imagination points to all we might yet discover and create.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Think big thoughts but relish small pleasures.
author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.

text: Irony is the gaiety of reflection and the joy of wisdom.
author: Anatole France

text: When in doubt, don't.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: He who knows that enough is enough will always have enough.
author: Laozi

text: 'All conditioned things are impermanent' — when one sees this with wisdom, one turns away from suffering.
author: The Buddha

text: You can stand tall without standing on someone. You can be a victor without having victims.
author: Harriet Woods

text: The way you see people is the way you treat them, and the way you treat them is what they become.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: Injuries may be forgiven, but not forgotten.
author: Aesop

text: All experiences are preceded by mind, having mind as their master, created by mind.
author: The Buddha

text: Everything you are against weakens you. Everything you are for empowers you.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: Let us revere, let us worship, but erect and open-eyed, the highest, not the lowest; the future, not the past!
author: Charlotte Perkins Gilman

text: To acquire knowledge, one must study; but to acquire wisdom, one must observe.
author: Marilyn vos Savant

text: There is nothing permanent except change.
author: Heraclitus

text: All human wisdom is summed up in two words; wait and hope.
author: Alexandre Dumas

text: The fall of dropping water wears away the Stone.
author: Lucretius

text: To make no mistakes is not in the power of man; but from their errors and mistakes the wise and good learn wisdom for the future.
author: Plutarch

text: That old law about 'an eye for an eye' leaves everybody blind. The time is always right to do the right thing.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: What makes Superman a hero is not that he has power, but that he has the wisdom and the maturity to use the power wisely. From an acting point of view, that's how I approached the part.
author: Christopher Reeve

text: Irrigators channel waters; fletchers straighten arrows; carpenters bend wood; the wise master themselves.
author: The Buddha

text: Those who cannot learn from history are doomed to repeat it.
author: George Santayana

text: The greater our knowledge increases the more our ignorance unfolds.
author: John F. Kennedy

text: Just as a mother would protect her only child with her life, even so let one cultivate a boundless love towards all beings.
author: The Buddha

text: Change your thoughts and you change your world.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

text: Things do not change; we change.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: From wonder into wonder existence opens.
author: Laozi

text: You should ignore that person’s impure behavior by way of speech and body, and focus on the fact that they get an openness and clarity of heart from time to time. That’s how to get rid of resentment for that person.
author: The Buddha

text: It is the province of knowledge to speak, and it is the privilege of wisdom to listen.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr.

text: To wear your heart on your sleeve isn't a very good plan; you should wear it inside, where it functions best.
author: Margaret Thatcher

text: You can fool all the people some of the time, and some of the people all the time, but you cannot fool all the people all the time.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Imagination is the highest kite one can fly.
author: Lauren Bacall

text: It is never too late to be what you might have been.
author: George Eliot

text: The more sand that has escaped from the hourglass of our life, the clearer we should see through it.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

text: Character is like a tree and reputation like a shadow. The shadow is what we think of it; the tree is the real thing.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: A mind unruffled by the vagaries of fortune, from sorrow freed, from defilements cleansed, from fear liberated — this is the greatest blessing.
author: The Buddha

text: Do not give your attention to what others do or fail to do; give it to what you do or fail to do.
author: Dhammapada

text: Discipline is the bridge between goals and accomplishment.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Most people are about as happy as they make up their minds to be
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Honesty is the best policy.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Argue for your limitations, and sure enough they're yours.
author: Richard Bach

text: It is the supreme art of the teacher to awaken joy in creative expression and knowledge.
author: Albert Einstein

text: We don't know a millionth of one percent about anything.
author: Thomas Edison

text: Imagination is more important than knowledge...
author: Albert Einstein

text: A little knowledge that acts is worth infinitely more than much knowledge that is idle.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: Knowledge is going to make you stronger. Knowledge is going to let you control your life. Knowledge is going to give you the wisdom to teach their children. Knowledge is the thing that makes you smile in the face of disaster.
author: Avery Brooks

text: Wisdom is a kind of knowledge. It is knowledge of the nature, career, and consequences of human values.
author: Sidney Hook

text: Sorrow is knowledge, those that know the most must mourn the deepest, the tree of knowledge is not the tree of life.
author: Lord Byron

text: All our knowledge has its origins in our perceptions.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: True knowledge exists in knowing that you know nothing.
author: Isocrates

text: Knowledge rests not upon truth alone, but upon error also.
author: Carl Jung

text: Beware of false knowledge; it is more dangerous than ignorance.
author: Bernard Shaw

text: Where is the Life we have lost in living? Where is the wisdom we have lost in knowledge? Where is the knowledge we have lost in information?
author: George Eliot

text: If you have knowledge, let others light their candles in it.
author: Margaret Fuller

text: A good decision is based on knowledge and not on numbers.
author: Plato

text: Science gives us knowledge, but only philosophy can give us wisdom.
author: Will Durant

text: Knowledge without justice ought to be called cunning rather than wisdom.
author: Plato

text: Life is a travelling to the edge of knowledge, then a leap taken.
author: Laurence J. Peter

text: The beginning of knowledge is the discovery of something we do not understand.
author: Frank Herbert

text: True friendship can afford true knowledge. It does not depend on darkness and ignorance.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: The doorstep to the temple of wisdom is a knowledge of our own ignorance.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Wisdom is the power to put our time and our knowledge to the proper use.
author: Thomas J. Watson

text: In friendship as well as love, ignorance very often contributes more to our happiness than knowledge.
author: François de La Rochefoucauld

text: Knowledge is proud that it knows so much; wisdom is humble that it knows no more.
author: William Cowper

text: The superior man understands what is right; the inferior man understands what will sell.
author: Confucius

text: To be wronged is nothing unless you continue to remember it.
author: Confucius

text: Wisdom, compassion, and courage are the three universally recognized moral qualities of men.
author: Confucius

text: If you look into your own heart, and you find nothing wrong there, what is there to worry about? What is there to fear?
author: Confucius

text: Wherever you go, go with all your heart.
author: Confucius

text: When you see a good person, think of becoming like him. When you see someone not so good, reflect on your own weak points.
author: Confucius

text: The cautious seldom err.
author: Confucius

text: He who wishes to secure the good of others, has already secured his own.
author: Confucius

text: I hear and I forget. I see and I remember. I do and I understand.
author: Confucius

text: Learning without reflection is a waste, reflection without learning is dangerous.
author: Confucius

text: I want you to be everything that's you, deep at the center of your being.
author: Confucius

text: The more man meditates upon good thoughts, the better will be his world and the world at large.
author: Confucius

text: Being in humaneness is good. If we select other goodness and thus are far apart from humaneness, how can we be the wise?
author: Confucius

text: When it is obvious that the goals cannot be reached, don't adjust the goals, adjust the action steps.
author: Confucius

text: The will to win, the desire to succeed, the urge to reach your full potential... these are the keys that will unlock the door to personal excellence.
author: Confucius

text: By three methods we may learn wisdom: First, by reflection, which is noblest; Second, by imitation, which is easiest; and third by experience, which is the bitterest.
author: Confucius

text: Reviewing what you have learned and learning anew, you are fit to be a teacher.
author: Confucius

text: Some of the best lessons we ever learn are learned from past mistakes. The error of the past is the wisdom and success of the future.
author: Dale Turner

text: Give me a lever long enough and a fulcrum on which to place it, and I shall move the world.
author: Archimedes

text: A heart well prepared for adversity in bad times hopes, and in good times fears for a change in fortune.
author: Horace

text: To profit from good advice requires more wisdom than to give it.
author: Wilson Mizner

text: People usually compare the computer to the head of the human being. I would say that hardware is the bone of the head, the skull. The semiconductor is the brain within the head. The software is the wisdom. And data is the knowledge.
author: Masayoshi Son

text: Speak only endearing speech, speech that is welcomed. Speech, when it brings no evil to others, is a pleasant thing.
author: The Buddha

text: One is not called noble who harms living beings. By not harming living beings one is called noble.
author: The Buddha

text: Democracy's premise rests on the notion that the collective wisdom of the majority will prove right more often than it's wrong; that given sufficient opportunity in the pursuit of happiness, your population will develop its talents, its intellect, its better judgment; that over time its capacity for discernment and self-correction will be enlarged.
author: Ben Fountain

text: Even if you're on the right track, you'll get run over if you just sit there.
author: Will Rogers

text: Excellence, then, is a state concerned with choice, lying in a mean, relative to us, this being determined by reason and in the way in which the man of practical wisdom would determine it.
author: Aristotle

text: Delight in heedfulness! Guard well your thoughts!
author: The Buddha

text: Leave no stone unturned.
author: Euripides

text: If you set out to be liked, you would be prepared to compromise on anything at any time, and you would achieve nothing.
author: Margaret Thatcher

text: If you don't know where you are going, any road will get you there.
author: Lewis Carroll

text: It is in the nature of things that joy arises in a person free from remorse.
author: The Buddha

text: A ruffled mind makes a restless pillow.
author: Charlotte Brontë

text: There are three classes of men; lovers of wisdom, lovers of honor, and lovers of gain.
author: Plato

text: The lure of the distant and the difficult is deceptive. The great opportunity is where you are.
author: John Burroughs

text: Work like you don't need the money. Love like you've never been hurt. Dance like nobody's watching.
author: Satchel Paige

text: Our shared values define us more than our differences. And acknowledging those shared values can see us through our challenges today if we have the wisdom to trust in them again.
author: John McCain

text: Silence is a source of great strength.
author: Laozi

text: Genius unrefined resembles a flash of lightning, but wisdom is like the sun.
author: Franz Grillparzer

text: He who talks more is sooner exhausted.
author: Laozi

text: Keep me away from the wisdom which does not cry, the philosophy which does not laugh and the greatness which does not bow before children.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: The superior man is modest in his speech but exceeds in his actions.
author: Confucius

text: May all beings have happy minds.
author: The Buddha

text: Being entirely honest with oneself is a good exercise.
author: Sigmund Freud

text: The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity. The fears are paper tigers. You can do anything you decide to do. You can act to change and control your life; and the procedure, the process is its own reward.
author: Amelia Earhart

text: Pick battles big enough to matter, small enough to win.
author: Jonathan Kozol

text: Train up a fig tree in the way it should go, and when you are old sit under the shade of it.
author: Charles Dickens

text: Spectacular achievement is always preceded by unspectacular preparation.
author: Robert Schuller

text: There are three methods to gaining wisdom. The first is reflection, which is the highest. The second is limitation, which is the easiest. The third is experience, which is the bitterest.
author: Confucius

text: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.
author: Confucius

text: It's better to be a lion for a day than a sheep all your life.
author: Elizabeth Kenny

text: When a thing is done, it's done. Don't look back. Look forward to your next objective.
author: George Marshall

text: 'As I am, so are these. As are these, so am I.' Drawing the parallel to yourself, neither kill nor get others to kill.
author: The Buddha

text: There are more quarrels smothered by just shutting your mouth, and holding it shut, than by all the wisdom in the world.
author: Henry Ward Beecher
